title: Best Ever Biscuits
instructions: Combine the flour, baking powder and the salt in a mixing bowl.  Work in the butter (or shortening) with your fingers.  Combine the baking soda and the buttermilk and stir it thoroughly into the flour mixture with a fork.

Sprinkle flour generously on a working surface and empty the dough onto the working surface.  It is important to not overwork the dough but work the dough into soft dough; patting it into a round of about 1-inch thickness.  Cut out the biscuits with a 2-inch cutter (remember to coat the cutter in flour as you cut out the biscuits).
Put the biscuits in oil insuring that they are thoroughly covered in oil and immediately place them on a greased baking sheet; insuring that all the biscuits are touching.
Bake them in the hot oven for 8 to 10 minutes; or, until they are lightly browned.
Source:  Bread Recipe Stirs Memories, Dining Section,  Express-News, Wednesday, February 14, 2007.
